etymology.description: semantic: 士(士) (shì, "scholar") + phonetic: 叀(叀) (zhuān) = scholar sitting to listen to learn and live long -> longevity
etymology.interpretation: The character 寿(壽) (shòu, "longevity") combines a depiction of scholarship and learning with a phonetic component to convey the idea of living a long life through knowledge and wisdom.
etymology.simplification: During simplification, 壽(壽) was streamlined to 寿(壽) by removing the complex elements and retaining a simpler form while preserving the phonetic and semantic essence.

examples.chinese: 他盼望长寿(他盼望長壽)。
家人团聚时(家人團聚時)，大家都祝愿长寿(大家都祝願長壽)。
examples.pinyin: Jiārén tuánjù shí, dàjiā dōu zhùyuàn chángshòu.
examples.english: When the family gathers, everyone wishes for longevity.

examples.chinese: 寿星收到贺卡祝福(壽星收到賀卡祝福)。
examples.english: The birthday person receives wishes on a greeting card.
